title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 93.1 - Room service
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 93.1 - Room service

State Regulations

The furnishing of room service is defined as the manual
delivery of food and/or beverages on a tray, serving cart or table, at the
order of a registered hotel guest, from a bar or kitchen of the licensed hotel
by a waiter, waitress or other hotel employee performing the same function, to
the room occupied by said guest, which food or beverages are to be consumed in
the hotel room occupied by such guest. Nothing in this Part shall permit the
sale of alcoholic beverages by vending machines or other mechanical
devices. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

93.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
